subprocess_flow.description: The Architecture Review Board (ARB) prepares for the compliance review by gathering all necessary documentation, including the Migration Plan Document, architecture specifications, and any relevant implementation artifacts. This involves ensuring that all documents are up-to-date and readily accessible for review. The ARB also defines the scope and criteria for the compliance check to ensure a consistent and thorough evaluation.
success_criteria: All necessary documentation is gathered and up-to-date
Review scope and compliance criteria are clearly defined
subprocess_flow.purpose: To prepare for a thorough and consistent compliance review.
end_conditions: Review scope and compliance criteria are defined

subprocess_flow.description: The Architecture Review Board conducts regular compliance checks to ensure that the implementation aligns with the defined architecture. This involves comparing the actual implementation against the architecture specifications and identifying any deviations or violations. Automated compliance tools and manual inspections are used to thoroughly assess the implementation.
success_criteria: Deviations and violations are identified and documented
subprocess_flow.purpose: To identify any deviations from the defined architecture during implementation.
end_conditions: Compliance checks are completed and documented

subprocess_flow.description: Based on the compliance findings, the Architecture Review Board develops risk mitigation plans to address any identified architecture violations. This involves defining specific actions to correct the deviations and prevent future occurrences. The risk mitigation plans are documented and communicated to the implementation team.
success_criteria: Risk mitigation plans are developed for all identified architecture violations
Corrective actions are clearly defined and documented
subprocess_flow.purpose: To address and correct any identified architecture violations.
end_conditions: Risk mitigation plans are documented and communicated

subprocess_flow.description: The implementation team implements the corrective actions defined in the risk mitigation plans. This involves making the necessary changes to the implementation to align with the architecture specifications. The implementation team documents all changes and provides evidence of compliance to the Architecture Review Board.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To correct deviations and ensure compliance with the architecture.
end_conditions: Corrective actions are implemented and documented

subprocess_flow.description: The Architecture Review Board verifies that the corrective actions have been implemented effectively and that the implementation now complies with the architecture specifications. This involves reviewing the updated implementation artifacts and compliance evidence. If compliance is verified, the implementation is approved; otherwise, further corrective actions are required.
subprocess_flow.purpose: To verify that the implementation now complies with the architecture.
